articles.title: Zubeen Garg case: Assam probe team to visit Singapore, CM vows fast-track trial
articles.excerpt: The Assam government has announced a series of measures to expedite the investigation into the death of singer Zubeen Garg, a cultural icon in India’s northeast. Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma said a Special Investigation Team (SIT), led by ADGP Munna Prasad Gupta, will travel to Singapore on October 20 to meet local police officials to coordinate on evidence related to Garg’s death. The visit, facilitated by External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar, is part of efforts to ensure international cooperation in the case.

articles.title: Jury finds woman guilty in the fatal stabbing of 3 year old outside a Cleveland-area supermarket
articles.excerpt: Subscribe Now! Get features like CLEVELAND — A jury has found an Ohio woman guilty in the fatal stabbing of a 3-year-old boy as he sat in a grocery cart outside a supermarket in suburban Cleveland. Bionca Ellis, 34, of Cleveland, will be sentenced Oct. 27 by Cuyahoga County Common Pleas Judge John Russo, who can choose between life in prison with or without the opportunity for parole.
articles.content_snippet: Subscribe Now! Get features like CLEVELAND — A jury has found an Ohio woman guilty in the fatal stabbing of a 3-year-old boy as he sat in a grocery cart outside a supermarket in suburban Cleveland. Bionca Ellis, 34, of Cleveland, will be sentenced Oct. 27 by Cuyahoga County Common Pleas Judge John Russo, who can choose between life in prison with or without the opportunity for parole. She has been held in jail on a $5 million bond since being indicted by a grand jury last year.

articles.title: Court orders takedown of Akshay Kumar deepfakes, cites public order risk
articles.excerpt: The Bombay High Court has issued strong directions against the circulation of AI-generated deepfake videos and morphed images of actor Akshay Kumar, calling them “deeply concerning” and potentially harmful to public order. Justice Arif S Doctor granted Akshay Kumar temporary relief without hearing the opposing parties, noting that the deepfake video, featuring Kumar allegedly making communally inflammatory statements and remarks about Rishi Valmiki, posed both reputational damage and a risk to public safety. “The morphing is so sophisticated and deceptive that it is virtually impossible to discern that these are not genuine images or videos of the plaintiff,” the court noted..

articles.title: Cabin crew may get longer rest, fewer landings under new aviation draft rules
articles.excerpt: Aviation safety regulator DGCA has issued draft duty and rest period norms for the cabin crew. As per the draft rules, for a maximum flight duty period of 11 hours, as many as six landings have been allowed, while for 11.30 hours, the maximum limit for landings has been kept at five. Similarly, for 12 hours and 12.30 hours flight duty period, the number of landings allowed stands at four and three landings, respectively.

articles.title: Stop killings in Gaza or we will have no choice but to go in: Trump threatens Hamas
articles.excerpt: United States President Donald Trump on Thursday issued a warning to Hamas after a video surfaced showing a public execution in Gaza following a ceasefire deal with Israel. The video, widely condemned, prompted Trump to say the US would intervene directly should such executions persist. In a post on his social media, Trump wrote, "If Hamas continues to kill people in Gaza, which was not the Deal, we will have no choice but to go in and kill them.".

The suspension came after students staged protests demanding the removal of the teacher, alleging that she had mentally harassed the 14-year-old boy. articles.title: Hasina deserves 1,400 death sentences, seeking just one: Bangladesh prosecutor
articles.excerpt: The chief prosecutor, presenting arguments before the International Crimes Tribunal-1, on Thursday sought the death penalty for ousted Bangladesh Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina for deaths during the uprising in July-August last year. The prosecution said Hasina, who is currently in India, deserved "1,400 death sentences" for the killings. Former inspector general of police (IGP) Chowdhury Abdullah Al-Mamun has already admitted to the allegations of killings and mass murder during the last few weeks of the Hasina regime.

articles.title: Video: Kapil Sharma's Canada cafe attacked again, man fires shots from car
articles.excerpt: A chilling video showing gunman opening fire at Kapil Sharma’s popular Kap’s Cafe in Surrey, Canada, has gone viral, marking the third attack on the comedian’s international venture. The footage, recorded on Thursday, shows a man firing multiple rounds from a moving car at the recently reopened cafe. The video clearly shows a shooter firing repeatedly at the cafe’s glass facade, from inside the vehicle.
articles.content_snippet: A chilling video showing gunman opening fire at Kapil Sharma’s popular Kap’s Cafe in Surrey, Canada, has gone viral, marking the third attack on the comedian’s international venture. The footage, recorded on Thursday, shows a man firing multiple rounds from a moving car at the recently reopened cafe. The video clearly shows a shooter firing repeatedly at the cafe’s glass facade, from inside the vehicle. Windows shatter under the barrage, while staff and patrons reportedly scramble for safety.

articles.title: Delhi Gasps: Pollution Causes Heart Attacks, Strokes, Reduces Lifespan, Doctors Warn
articles.excerpt: This special report focuses on 12th-grade student Adith Kumar and his investigation into serious flaws within Delhi's air quality monitoring system, which are now corroborated by a CAG report. Adith Kumar states that upon questioning the authorities about the report's findings, he was told 'action had not been taken despite it being over almost a year since it has been published.' Through RTI appeals, Adith uncovered that AQI monitoring stations are allegedly placed in violation of CPCB guidelines, such as near forested areas, potentially to display lower pollution readings. This programme explores his findings, the damning 2025 Comptroller and Auditor General (CAG) report that confirms these irregularities, and the bureaucratic apathy that allows this flawed data to misinform public health decisions in the capital..

articles.title: Bengaluru's Billion-Dollar Tech Dreams Clash With Crumbling Roads, Garbage Crisis
articles.excerpt: The Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) has refuted claims made by US President Donald Trump regarding a phone call with Prime Minister Narendra Modi about India halting its purchase of Russian oil. MEA Spokesperson Randhir Jaiswal stated, 'I am not aware of any conversation yesterday between the two leaders.' In response to the claims, the MEA issued a formal statement clarifying that India's oil import policies are determined by the priority to protect Indian consumer interests in a volatile energy market. The ministry noted that ensuring stable energy prices and secure supplies are the twin goals of India's policy, which involves diversifying energy sources to meet market conditions.

articles.title: NCLAT asks for proceeds from sale of Jet Airways aircraft to be kept in escrow pending resolution of Mumbai airport dues | Company Business News
articles.excerpt: The National Company Law Appellate Tribunal (NCLAT) on Thursday directed the Jet Airways liquidator to keep the proceeds from the sale of three grounded Boeing 777-300ER aircraft to Malta-based Ace Aviation in an escrow account until a dispute over dues payable to Mumbai International Airport Ltd (MIAL) is resolved. The bench, led by Justice N. Seshasayee (Judicial Member) and Barun Mitra (Technical Member), asked the National Company Law Tribunal Mumbai to decide the matter regarding MIAL’s airport dues, while granting lenders and the liquidator the liberty to approach NCLT or NCLAT for any clarification.

articles.title: Israel Central Bank Chief Wants to See More Clarity on Ceasefire
articles.excerpt: Governor of Israel's central bank Amir Yaron Israel’s central bank chief said policymakers will move “very cautiously” on interest-rate cuts given the uncertainty over the US-orchestrated ceasefire deal to end the war with Hamas. Governor Amir Yaron said two factors were at play — an alleviation in the labor market as reservists return to the workforce and a potential boost in consumer sentiment with the deal. But policymakers will want to see “clarity” that inflation, which has returned to the Bank of Israel’s target range, remains subdued..

articles.title: Sam Altman defends ChatGPT’s ‘Adult Mode’ plans, says OpenAI isn’t the ‘moral police of the world’ | Mint
articles.excerpt: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman has issued a clarification on the upcoming Adult Mode for ChatGPT. Just a day earlier, Altman had announced that ChatGPT would soon allow for adult content including erotica for verified users, which had led to a lot of criticism on social media. ​A day later, Altman clarified that the erotica example was only meant to be an example of how ChatGPT would allow more freedom to adult users while noting that the company is not the 'elected moral police of the world.' ​"This tweet about upcoming changes to ChatGPT blew up on the erotica point much more than I thought it was going to! It was meant to be just one example of us allowing more user freedom for adults," Altman noted in a post on X..
articles.content_snippet: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman has issued a clarification on the upcoming Adult Mode for ChatGPT. articles.title: 777 Partners Co-Founder Wander Charged With $500 Million Fraud
articles.excerpt: '777 Partners' co-founder Josh Wander Josh Wander, the co-founder of Miami investment firm 777 Partners, was charged with conspiracy and fraud for allegedly cheating lenders and investors in the firm out of almost $500 million. According to Manhattan federal prosecutors, Wander lied and used fake financial documents to inflate the firm’s finances. Wander surrendered to federal agents Thursday morning and was expected to appear in court later in the day..

Trending Photos In its continued crackdown on terror networks and their facilitators, Budgam Police on Wednesday attached property belonging to a Pakistan-based terror handler under the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act - UAPA. articles.title: Thousands in UK take legal action against Johnson & Johnson over alleged talc cancer link
articles.excerpt: High court claim says company knowingly sold product containing asbestos and ‘concealed’ risk to public ‘When I was a child, everyone used it’: woman blames Johnson & Johnson talc for her cancer Thousands of people are taking legal action against the US pharmaceutical company Johnson & Johnson, claiming it knowingly sold baby powder containing asbestos-contaminated talc in the UK. About 3,000 people have alleged that they or a family member developed forms of ovarian cancer or mesothelioma from using Johnson’s Baby Powder, and are seeking damages at the high court in London. Lawyers for the group said Johnson & Johnson, along with its current and former subsidiaries Johnson & Johnson Management and Kenvue UK, should all be held liable, according to court documents filed on Thursday by KP Law.

articles.content_snippet: JB Hunt Transport Services Inc. shares rose in late trading after the freight transportation company reported a quarterly profit that topped expectations. Bloomberg's Lee Klaskow reports. (Source: Bloomberg)

articles.title: Timely arrival: Great British Railways clock launches at London Bridge
articles.excerpt: Digital timepiece is UK rail’s first national clock in more than 50 years and will be seen at stations across the country Commuters rushing through London Bridge station may have missed it, but on Thursday morning a new era in railway timekeeping and design was looming above them: a 1.8-metre-high digital timepiece, hanging above the concourse, the first physical manifestation of the Great British Railways’ signature station clock. The design, the first such for more than 50 years, will appear in digital form on electronic information boards at stations across Britain. The black and red clock face draws on the old British Rail logo, which the rail minister, Peter Hendy, said “represents a bridge between the historic past and a new future for our railways”.

articles.title: Brazil to ask countries to quadruple biofuel use, leak suggests
articles.excerpt: Exclusive: Document sets draft pledge for leaders gathering at climate conference to increase usage of controversial fuels Brazil will ask countries to quadruple the global use of controversial biofuels despite concerns from environmental experts, the Guardian has learned. A leaked document seen by the Guardian sets out a draft pledge for world leaders gathering at the climate conference next month in Brazil to increase the use of biofuels in the next decade by four times compared with 2024 levels. Brazil is the world’s second largest producer of ethanol, one of several types of biofuel.

articles.title: Japan bear attacks hit record high with seven people killed this year
articles.excerpt: The number of people killed by bears in Japan this year has reached a record high, the country's environment ministry has said. Seven people have died since April - the highest since 2006 when data was first recorded - with fatalities mostly in north-eastern regions and the northern prefecture of Hokkaido. A 60-year-old man cleaning an outdoor hot spring bath has gone missing what is suspected to be the latest incident.

articles.title: Pro-Palestinian messages disrupt public address systems at North American airports
articles.excerpt: Unauthorised pro-Palestinian messages were broadcast through public address systems at four airports in North America on Tuesday, disrupting operations and prompting security investigations. The incidents occurred at Harrisburg International Airport in Pennsylvania, Kelowna International Airport, Victoria International Airport in Canada's British Columbia, and Windsor International Airport in Ontario. Videos posted by travellers showed recordings that praised Hamas and criticised both President Donald Trump and Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu.

articles.title: What's King Salman Gate mega-project in Mecca that will house 9 lakh pilgrims?
articles.excerpt: Saudi Crown Prince and Prime Minister Mohammed bin Salman has announced the launch of the King Salman Gate project, adjacent to the Grand Mosque in Mecca city. Spanning 12 million square metres, the multi-use project aims to redefine Mecca city's central area as a global benchmark for sustainable urban development, enhancing services for pilgrims and visitors while aligning with Saudi Arabia's Pilgrim Experience Programme. Saudi Arabia's Vision 2030 is aimed at reshaping the kingdom's economy, channelling billions into tourism and infrastructure to wean the nation off its reliance on oil for growth.

articles.title: Kocher Advocates for ECB Calm With Policy in a ‘Good Place’

articles.title: Head of IMF says risks in private credit market keep her awake at night
articles.excerpt: Kristalina Georgieva urges vigilance over ‘very significant shift of financing’ after collapse of Tricolor and First Brands The head of the International Monetary Fund has admitted that worrying about the risks building up in non-bank lending markets keeps her awake at night. Kristalina Georgieva on Thursday urged countries to pay more attention to the private credit market, after the failure of the sub-prime auto lender Tricolor and the car parts supplier First Brands. Speaking at the IMF’s annual meeting in Washington DC, Georgieva said the fund was concerned about the “very significant shift of financing” from the banking sector to non-bank financial institutions (NBFIs).

articles.title: Baichung Bhutia blasts Sunil Chhetri, tells him to hang up his boots after Asian Cup failure: ‘Comeback was a mistake’
articles.excerpt: Subscribe Now! Get features like India’s campaign aiming to qualify for the AFC Asian Cup came to a grinding halt as they lost to Singapore, being knocked out of the running for progressing from the third round of qualification despite there still being two games to go. It marks the low point in what has been a year or two to forget in Indian football, not able to continue the upward trend that qualifying for this tournament in 2019 and 2023 had promised. articles.title: Wary of Taliban ceasefire, Pak runs to Trump, makes bizarre India claim
articles.excerpt: Will Donald Trump get to solve a ninth conflict soon, the one between Pakistan and the Taliban, and add another "peace trophy" to his cabinet? As tensions simmer over a fragile ceasefire with the Taliban in Afghanistan, Pakistan has turned to the US President to help ease tensions. The appeal by Pakistani defence minister Khawaja Asif came as Islamabad and the Taliban agreed a temporary ceasefire after week-long border clashes and Pakistani air strikes on Kabul and Kandahar left scores dead on both sides. advertisementPAK'S APPEAL TO DONALD TRUMPIn an interview with GeoTV, Asif continued Pakistan's tradition of over-the-top flattery of Trump and welcomed him to mediate between the former allies.

articles.title: Afghanistan-Pakistan war: Who blinked first and ran seeking truce?
articles.excerpt: An uneasy calm prevails along the Durand Line as of now, after Afghanistan and Pakistan agreed upon a 48-hour ceasefire. A border conflict escalated into a deadly war between Afghanistan and Pakistan that left hundreds dead, with Pakistan using fighter jets and drones to target civilian areas inside Afghanistan, and Taliban fighters overrunning border outposts. But who called for a ceasefire first amid images of bombing, seizure of arms and blown-off border gates? Was it Pakistan, which ran for cover during Operation Sindoor too, or was it the Taliban-ruled Islamic Emirate of Afghanistan? The answers seemingly depend on which side of the border you're standing on or whom you are listening to.

articles.title: FIIs Return To Indian Markets, Pump In Over Rs 10,000 Crore In October
articles.excerpt: Provisional data from the NSE also indicates that FIIs continued their buying streak on October 15, adding another Rs 162 crore. Trending Photos Mumbai: After months of selling, foreign investors seem to be regaining confidence in Indian stock markets as the data from NSDL shows that between October 7 and October 14, Foreign Institutional Investors (FIIs) were net buyers in five of the last seven trading sessions, purchasing shares worth over Rs 3,000 crore in the secondary market. Their buying in the primary market was even stronger, crossing Rs 7,600 crore, as per the data.
